name: BEST WESTERN PLUS Universal Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel from January 3 a January 6. It was my first time visiting this area and this hotel so I wasn't sure of the transportation from the airport to the hotel. I called the hotel from the airport and was told by a lady to take a taxi. The ride was about 20 minutes, mostly on a highway/freeway and it cost $46 (one way from airport to hotel).
reviews.title: Clean, fast and friendly

reviews.text: The hotel is located in the same plaza as a few restaurant: golden corral (American style buffet), a Japanese restaurant, Chinese restaurant, a sports bar, burger king, a liquor store and a very convincing drug store.
reviews.title: Best combination of location and value

reviews.text: Check in was very fast and friendly. The lady who checked us in (I forgot her name) told us everything we needed to know: when the complimentary breakfast was served, when the shuttle bus to and from universal studio arrives and departs, the non smoking policy, etc.
reviews.title: Very Nice Stay

reviews.text: We booked through Expedia and was given a 2 queen size bed room, but since I was traveling with my girlfriend, I asked if there was a single king size bed. There was, but the catch is that it didn't have a bathtub, only shower. We took it.
reviews.title: Second Time Around

reviews.text: The room was comfortable and clean. The bed was a little too high for my liking and the pillows were a little too high as well, but I'm very glad the air conditioning and heating unit works very well and it heated the room very fast, and vice versa. My only major complain about our room was that the shower was extremely weak. Barely any water flowing, which made the shower a little uncomfortable.
reviews.title: Loved our stay here!

reviews.text: Arrived to find, after paying, that my reserved type of room was no available and they had assigned 4 of us to a one-bed room. The desk clerk insisted that was what I had reserved until I showed her my printed reservation e-mail, and then offered to put two roll-aways into an already small room. After declining she then spent the next hour+ trying to figure out the reservation and how to refund the one night charge already processed. We finally gave up, called the credit car company to block the charges and went to another hotel.
reviews.title: Rude and uncaring

reviews.text: After complaining to BW management (never heard a word of apology from the hotel management) I was offered a few 1000 points, which were worthless unless I stayed with them again. I will NEVER stay at a BW again!
reviews.title: Good place to use as base..

reviews.text: We stayed for six nights in order to visit Universal Studios. The hotel was great with a pool for our days not at the park. Room was comfortable. We stayed on 3rd floor rear which was very quiet. The window was really opaque, i presume from sunshine but really needs replacing. This kept out a lot of light. The fridge had a noise issue during the night but not enough to make a big issue. The breakfast served its purpose and gave you you enough choice to be satisfied. Coffee on tap all of the time. The staff were all very helpful and gave good advice. We used the Orlando Ale House right opposite the hotel for most meals. It provided a great choice of food and the drinks were very good value. It was always busy of an evening but not noisy. We used the itrolley buses to get around, we avoided the hire car because with the limited use and the cost to park at Universal it was just not worth it. Walk from hotel to Universal was a very relaxed 15 minute stroll. We had a good break at this hotel and would certainly use again if we were in the Universal Orlando area.
reviews.title: Excellent value for Universal Studios area

reviews.text: Basic, but clean and good size. Free parking and shuttle service (a 5-min ride) to Universal Studios. A free family restaurants close by (within walking distance). A basic breakfast is included in an extremely reasonable price, however, facilities are also limited.
reviews.title: Great value!

reviews.text: I would suggest renting a car if you plan on visiting other parts of Orlando. One of the two Premium Outlet malls is less than a 10-minute drive away.
reviews.title: Just All Around Great!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was clean, service was friendly, beds were okay. When they say "across the street from Universal" it should read "across the street from the entrance to Universal". It's a bit of a walk to get to the actual park. Lots of restaurants within walking distance. An Avis rental station in the hotel right next door. Only ate breakfast once in the 3 days we were there but there was a lot of variety. Great location for a very reasonable price. Call your own taxi and save almost 30%. The company they use seems to be run by a family friend and fares are higher.
reviews.title: Great location and price

reviews.text: Very nice hotel, clean, friendly staff. Close to Universal Studios and interstate roads
reviews.title: My stay in Orlando

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is near the Universal Studios theme parks. Restaurants are within a short walk. There is also bus service for International Blvd. The hotel was very clean. The breakfast featured a good variety and the area was kept spotless. The value that we paid was reasonable.
reviews.title: a good choice

reviews.title: Clean and Neat, A visit I would Repeat.

reviews.text: This hotel was a pleasant surprise. Very clean and great staff.
reviews.title: Very Good Hotel

reviews.text: The breakfast was very good each morning and very close to Universal Studios.
reviews.title: Close to all - including Universal Studios Florida

reviews.text: They provide a shuttle to the park or it is close enough that you could walk.
reviews.title: Excellent value and a Super location to Universal Studios!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Prior to the trip, we're deciding between the Universal Inn and Orlando Gateway. We decided on this because it looked to be closer to Universal Studios, our ultimate destination. We're glad - even though the other BW claimed to be 'within walking distance', it would be a looooong walk! The Universal Inn is on a shopping/dining complex with the Fairfield Inn, so it's close to several restaurants, a Starbucks, a Walgreen and a gift shop. We ended up eating at two of the restaurants after long days at Universal, so the location is just ideal. Rooms are clean and very large, with a fridge and a microwave. Breakfast was on par with the other BWs we've stayed at. Staff (front desk, breakfast room personnel, housecleaning) were all very courteous and would actually greet you when you passed by. I only have a couple of comments: 1.the breakfast area is a bit too small, and most likely everyone ate at the same time (so we could all make our 'pilgrimage' to Universal :-> ) But I overheard that they might do some renovation to enlarge the breakfast area, so management was already aware of this need; 2. the noise we usually got was from the slamming of doors when guests went in/out of their rooms. If something can be done, say with the hinges, or patting around the door frame to reduce the noise, that would be even better. All said, we're very happy with our stay, and will definitely consider staying here again on our next trip to Universal!
reviews.title: Good for price but could improve on certain things.

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel so we could attend the Arnold Palmer Invitational Golf Tournament. I love the Best Western Hotel's and this location lived up to there excellent standards! Very clean and comfortable rooms and a full complimentary breakfast. Good choice if going to Universal Studios....It's just across the street!!!
reviews.title: A decent hotel
